pull.title: ci: Fix macOS-cross SDK rsync
pull.body:
This should fix the macOS-cross build on Cirrus CI containers.

Locally this was already working, because the SDK was cached in
`/ci_container_base/` in the image, which is also the folder used for a
later CI run.

However, on Cirrus CI, when using an image *and* a custom `BASE_ROOT_DIR`,
the SDK will not be found in `/ci_base_install/`, nor in `BASE_ROOT_DIR`.

Fix this by normalizing *all* folders to `/ci_container_base/`.

rename.from: ci: Fix corrupt macOS-cross depends cache

events.body: Changed the fix and added an explanation. Let's hope this works. I presume this was a silent merge conflict between 80d70cb6b04b5a3c13e661c0718a4b5108d55869 and 85e672ab3dfbbeec5255befcbcd239a11536be0e. cc @hebasto

Still fails:

```
clang: warning: no such sysroot directory: '/tmp/cirrus-ci-build/depends/SDKs/Xcode-12.2-12B45b-extracted-SDK-with-libcxx-headers' [-Wmissing-sysroot]
ld: library not found for -lc++
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
```

https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6482314977345536?logs=ci#L676
Re-run of the Cirrus task builds the depends packages regardless of caching: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5981899345100800

ci: Fix macOS-cross SDK rsync

This should fix the macOS-cross build on Cirrus CI containers.

Locally this was already working, because the SDK was cached in
/ci_container_base/ in the image, which is also the folder used for a
later CI run.

However, on Cirrus CI, when using an image *and* a custom BASE_ROOT_DIR,
the SDK will not be found in /ci_base_install/, nor in BASE_ROOT_DIR.

Fix this by normalizing *all* folders to /ci_container_base/.

Locally this was already working, because the SDK was cached in

However, on Cirrus CI, when using an image *and* a custom BASE_ROOT_DIR,
the SDK will not be found in /ci_base_install/, nor in BASE_ROOT_DIR.

Fix this by normalizing *all* folders to /ci_container_base/.

ci: Avoid error on macOS native

This avoids "mkdir: /ci_container_base: Read-only file system"

events.body:
> Re-run of the Cirrus task builds the depends packages regardless of caching: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5981899345100800

Good catch. The folder was empty. Should be fixed now.
Confirmed to be fixed now, see https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5805313979318272?logs=base_depends_built#L4

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -66,7 +66,7 @@ container_depends_template: &CONTAINER_DEPENDS_TEMPLATE
     dockerfile: ci/test_imagefile  # https://cirrus-ci.org/guide/docker-builder-vm/#dockerfile-as-a-ci-environment
   depends_built_cache:
     folder: "depends/built"
-    fingerprint_script: echo $CIRRUS_TASK_NAME $(git rev-parse HEAD:depends)
+    fingerprint_script: echo salt_001 $CIRRUS_TASK_NAME $(git rev-parse HEAD:depends)
comments.body: review note: This was done to  manually nuke the old cache and start a new depends build/cache for all tasks on Cirrus CI.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -66,7 +66,7 @@ container_depends_template: &CONTAINER_DEPENDS_TEMPLATE
     dockerfile: ci/test_imagefile  # https://cirrus-ci.org/guide/docker-builder-vm/#dockerfile-as-a-ci-environment
   depends_built_cache:
     folder: "depends/built"
-    fingerprint_script: echo $CIRRUS_TASK_NAME $(git rev-parse HEAD:depends)
+    fingerprint_script: echo salt_001 $CIRRUS_TASK_NAME $(git rev-parse HEAD:depends)
comments.body: Why is there a need to build a new `depends/built` cache in the first place?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -56,4 +56,4 @@ jobs:
           restore-keys: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-cache
 
       - name: CI script
-        run: ./ci/test_run_all.sh
+        run: env BASE_ROOT_DIR=$GITHUB_WORKSPACE ./ci/test_run_all.sh
comments.body:
fae6642af234cad6063945bcba7958168bf2687c, style nit, suggesting to set environment variables consistently throughout the entire `ci.yml` file, wherever possible:

```suggestion
        env:
          BASE_ROOT_DIR: ${{ github.workspace }}
        run: ./ci/test_run_all.sh
```
